title: Russian Attacks Along a Wide Arc of Ukraine Yield Little but Casualties
description: Moscow’s forces have stepped up artillery and infantry assaults across eastern Ukraine, trying to improve their position before either side attempts a major breakthrough.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: A U.S. Banking Crisis
description: Also, Russia is set to face war crimes charges and China’s new premier seeks to reassure investors.

title: 10 Years On, Pope Francis Faces Challenges From the Right and the Left
description: In an ideologically divided Roman Catholic Church, the right has accused him of going too far and the left of not going far enough.

title: A Female Mossad Agent’s Treasure Trove of Photos
description: Sylvia Rafael worked undercover as a news agency photographer. Her pictures for the Israeli spy agency sat in its archives for decades before being released for a show.

title: Cyclone Freddy Persists, Leaving Dozens More Dead in Africa, Red Cross Says
description: A storm that has broken records for its longevity — now 35 days — swept inland from the southeastern coast of Africa and is causing massive flooding and displacement.

title: ‘Navalny’ Wins Oscar for Best Documentary and His Wife Issues Message of Defiance
description: The film followed Aleksei Navalny, a prominent critic of President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, as he investigated his own near-fatal poisoning in 2020.

title: Grain deal, Bakhmut and more: What to watch for this week.
International Court to Open War Crimes Cases Against Russia, Officials Say
description: The cases before the International Criminal Court would accuse Russia of abducting Ukrainian children and of deliberately targeting civilian infrastructure.

title: An Indian tech company’s stock falls after it reveals a link to Silicon Valley Bank.
description: Nazara Technologies, a mobile gaming company, said two of its subsidiaries had together more than $7.7 million in balances at the failed bank.

title: Kenzaburo Oe, Nobel Laureate and Critic of Postwar Japan, Dies at 88
description: With his powerful novels and essays, Mr. Oe tried to ensure that Japan learned the lessons of its 20th-century militarism.

title: U.N. and Russian Officials Discuss Extending Grain Deal in Ukraine
description: Russia has not said whether it will support an expansion and says the U.S. and Europe have failed to hold up their part of the deal. Here’s what we are covering:

title: China’s New Premier Needs to Revive Growth. How Far Will Loyalty Get Him?
description: Li Qiang’s business-friendly reputation could bolster confidence in China’s economy. But he is stepping into a role with diminished power under Xi Jinping.

title: A New Bank Panic?
description: It’s a day of uncertainty for the U.S. economy.

title: Gary Lineker to Return to BBC Soccer Show ‘Match of the Day’
description: The move brings an end to a crisis for the network that had begun when the sports presenter was suspended because of a Twitter post about British immigration policy.

title: Kenzaburo Oe, Nobel Laureate and Critic of Postwar Japan, Dies at 88
description: With his powerful novels and essays, Mr. Oe tried to ensure that Japan learned the lessons of its 20th-century militarism.

title: ‘Russia Outside Russia’: For Elite, Dubai Becomes a Wartime Harbor
description: In the exclusive neighborhoods and palatial shopping malls of the United Arab Emirates’ biggest city, wealthy Russians can build a new life without having to cut ties to their home country.

title: Biden to Announce Nuclear-Powered Submarine Deal with Australia and Britain
description: The arrangement is part of a broader effort to counter China’s military development and assertive territorial claims across Asia.

title: As Economy Falters, China’s New Premier Tries to Boost Business Confidence
description: Li Qiang, the country’s No. 2 leader, sought to reassure entrepreneurs who have been wary of making new investments.

title: Zelensky names a soldier whose death was captured on video a Hero of Ukraine.
Your Monday Briefing
description: The collapse of three U.S. banks in a week.

title: North Korea Launches Cruise Missiles From Submarine
description: The missile test, the first of its kind carried out by the North, took place as South Korea and the United States were about to begin joint military exercises.
